title: Google\Cloud\Tasks\V2beta3\Queue
name: Queue
description:
A queue is a container of related tasks. Queues are configured to manage how those tasks are dispatched. Configurable properties include rate limits, retry options, queue types, and others.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Caller-specified and required in [CreateQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.CreateQueue], after which it becomes output only. The queue name. The queue name must have the following format: projects/PROJECT_ID/locations/LOCATION_ID/queues/QUEUE_ID PROJECT_ID can contain letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), hyphens (-), colons (:), or periods (.). For more information, see Identifying projects LOCATION_ID is the canonical ID for the queue's location. The list of available locations can be obtained by calling [ListLocations][google.cloud.location.Locations.ListLocations]. For more information, see https://cloud.google.com/about/locations/. * QUEUE_ID can contain letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), or hyphens (-). The maximum length is 100 characters.

params.name: data.app_engine_http_queue
params.description: [AppEngineHttpQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.AppEngineHttpQueue] settings apply only to [App Engine tasks][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.AppEngineHttpRequest] in this queue. [Http tasks][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.HttpRequest] are not affected by this proto.

params.name: data.rate_limits
params.description: Rate limits for task dispatches. [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits] and [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] are related because they both control task attempts. However they control task attempts in different ways: [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits] controls the total rate of dispatches from a queue (i.e. all traffic dispatched from the queue, regardless of whether the dispatch is from a first attempt or a retry). [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls what happens to particular a task after its first attempt fails. That is, [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls task retries (the second attempt, third attempt, etc). The queue's actual dispatch rate is the result of: Number of tasks in the queue User-specified throttling: [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits], [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config], and the [queue's state][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.state]. * System throttling due to 429 (Too Many Requests) or 503 (Service Unavailable) responses from the worker, high error rates, or to smooth sudden large traffic spikes.

params.name: data.retry_config
params.description: Settings that determine the retry behavior. For tasks created using Cloud Tasks: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue that were created using Cloud Tasks. Retry settings cannot be set on individual tasks. For tasks created using the App Engine SDK: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue which do not have retry settings explicitly set on the task and were created by the App Engine SDK. See App Engine documentation.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The state of the queue. state can only be changed by called [PauseQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.PauseQueue], [ResumeQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.ResumeQueue], or uploading queue.yaml/xml. [UpdateQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.UpdateQueue] cannot be used to change state.

params.name: data.purge_time
params.description: Output only. The last time this queue was purged. All tasks that were [created][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Task.create_time] before this time were purged. A queue can be purged using [PurgeQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.PurgeQueue], the App Engine Task Queue SDK, or the Cloud Console. Purge time will be truncated to the nearest microsecond. Purge time will be unset if the queue has never been purged.

params.name: data.stackdriver_logging_config
params.description: Configuration options for writing logs to Stackdriver Logging. If this field is unset, then no logs are written.

params.name: data.type
params.description: Immutable. The type of a queue (push or pull). Queue.type is an immutable property of the queue that is set at the queue creation time. When left unspecified, the default value of PUSH is selected.

methods.name: getName
methods.description:
Caller-specified and required in [CreateQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.CreateQueue], after which it becomes output only.

The queue name. The queue name must have the following format: projects/PROJECT_ID/locations/LOCATION_ID/queues/QUEUE_ID

  • PROJECT_ID can contain letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), hyphens (-), colons (:), or periods (.). For more information, see Identifying projects
  • LOCATION_ID is the canonical ID for the queue's location. The list of available locations can be obtained by calling [ListLocations][google.cloud.location.Locations.ListLocations]. For more information, see https://cloud.google.com/about/locations/.
  • QUEUE_ID can contain letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), or hyphens (-). The maximum length is 100 characters.

Generated from protobuf field string name = 1;

methods.name: getRateLimits
methods.description:
Rate limits for task dispatches.

[rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits] and [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] are related because they both control task attempts. However they control task attempts in different ways:

  • [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits] controls the total rate of dispatches from a queue (i.e. all traffic dispatched from the queue, regardless of whether the dispatch is from a first attempt or a retry).
  • [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls what happens to particular a task after its first attempt fails. That is, [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls task retries (the second attempt, third attempt, etc). The queue's actual dispatch rate is the result of:
  • Number of tasks in the queue
  • User-specified throttling: [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits], [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config], and the [queue's state][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.state].
  • System throttling due to 429 (Too Many Requests) or 503 (Service Unavailable) responses from the worker, high error rates, or to smooth sudden large traffic spikes.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.RateLimits rate_limits = 4;

  • [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits] controls the total rate of dispatches from a queue (i.e. all traffic dispatched from the queue, regardless of whether the dispatch is from a first attempt or a retry).
  • [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls what happens to particular a task after its first attempt fails. That is, [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config] controls task retries (the second attempt, third attempt, etc). The queue's actual dispatch rate is the result of:
  • Number of tasks in the queue
  • User-specified throttling: [rate_limits][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.rate_limits], [retry_config][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.retry_config], and the [queue's state][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.state].
  • System throttling due to 429 (Too Many Requests) or 503 (Service Unavailable) responses from the worker, high error rates, or to smooth sudden large traffic spikes.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.RateLimits rate_limits = 4;

methods.name: getRetryConfig
methods.description:
Settings that determine the retry behavior.

  • For tasks created using Cloud Tasks: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue that were created using Cloud Tasks. Retry settings cannot be set on individual tasks.
  • For tasks created using the App Engine SDK: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue which do not have retry settings explicitly set on the task and were created by the App Engine SDK. See App Engine documentation.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.RetryConfig retry_config = 5;

methods.name: setRetryConfig
methods.description:
Settings that determine the retry behavior.

  • For tasks created using Cloud Tasks: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue that were created using Cloud Tasks. Retry settings cannot be set on individual tasks.
  • For tasks created using the App Engine SDK: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue which do not have retry settings explicitly set on the task and were created by the App Engine SDK. See App Engine documentation.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.RetryConfig retry_config = 5;

params.name: var
params.description:
Settings that determine the retry behavior.

  • For tasks created using Cloud Tasks: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue that were created using Cloud Tasks. Retry settings cannot be set on individual tasks.
  • For tasks created using the App Engine SDK: the queue-level retry settings apply to all tasks in the queue which do not have retry settings explicitly set on the task and were created by the App Engine SDK. See App Engine documentation.

methods.name: getState
methods.description:
Output only. The state of the queue.

state can only be changed by called [PauseQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.PauseQueue], [ResumeQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.ResumeQueue], or uploading queue.yaml/xml. [UpdateQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.UpdateQueue] cannot be used to change state.

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.State state = 6;

Generated from protobuf field .google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Queue.State state = 6;

methods.name: getPurgeTime
methods.description:
Output only. The last time this queue was purged.

All tasks that were [created][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.Task.create_time] before this time were purged. A queue can be purged using [PurgeQueue][google.cloud.tasks.v2beta3.CloudTasks.PurgeQueue], the App Engine Task Queue SDK, or the Cloud Console. Purge time will be truncated to the nearest microsecond. Purge time will be unset if the queue has never been purged.

Generated from protobuf field .google.protobuf.Timestamp purge_time = 7;

methods.name: getType
methods.description:
Immutable. The type of a queue (push or pull).

Queue.type is an immutable property of the queue that is set at the queue creation time. When left unspecified, the default value of PUSH is selected.
